title: Questions, takeaways off every NFL Week 5 game: Patriots shock Bills; Bucs and Titans win thrillers
content: Our NFL Nation reporters answer the biggest questions out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 5.

title: Harbaugh sticking with DC Orr after latest defeat
content: Ravens coach John Harbaugh said he's sticking with defensive coordinator Zach Orr following Sunday's 44-10 loss to the Texans, the latest defensive meltdown in a season that continues to spiral for Baltimore.

title: Murray: Cards shocker 'How to Lose a Game 101'
content: QB Kyler Murray didn't know what to think after the Cardinals' 22-21 defeat to the lowly Titans -- a game that Arizona led 21-3 but that was ultimately derailed by two botched plays in the fourth quarter.

title: Maye leads win as Diggs shines in Buffalo return
content: New England quarterback Drake Maye delivered a "gutty performance" down the stretch, and wide receiver Stefon Diggs was sensational in an emotional return to Buffalo, as the Patriots shocked the Bills in prime time Sunday.

title: J-Rod 2B gives M's 1st home playoff win since '01
content: Outfielder Julio Rodriguez hit a tiebreaking RBI double in the eighth inning, and the Mariners outlasted the Detroit Tigers 3-2 in Game 2 of their AL Division Series on Sunday night, giving Seattle its first home playoff victory since Oct. 15, 2001.

title: Back in L.A., 'composed' Daniels jolts Commanders
content: Washington Commanders quarterback Jayden Daniels returned from injury, and playing for the first time near his hometown of San Bernardino, he helped orchestrate his club's 27-10 victory over the Los Angeles Chargers on Sunday afternoon at SoFi Stadium.

title: Panthers' Dowdle eyes Dallas after career game
content: After he rushed for 206 yards in the Panthers' comeback win, Rico Dowdle had a message for the Cowboys, Carolina's next opponent and his former team: "They got to buckle up."

title: Yanks confident in ability to rally at home vs. Jays
content: The Yankees expressed confidence in their ability to bounce back from a 2-0 deficit in the ALDS when they return home Tuesday for Game 3 vs. the Blue Jays.

title: Pete Carroll processing Raiders' 1-4 start 'poorly'
content: Pete Carroll expected to win right away with the Raiders, but instead Las Vegas is 1-4, and the coach said he's processing that fact "poorly."

title: üòà NFL Week 5 trolls: Saints' petty jab at Dart
content: The trolls were in full force during Week 5 of the NFL season, led by the New Orleans Saints poking fun at New York Giants rookie Jaxson Dart.

title: How shocking upsets and near misses of Week 6 impact conference, CFP races
content: How bleak are things for Penn State and Texas? What's next in the ACC and Big 12? Bill Connelly has answers.

title: Three Week 5 losses that Barnwell can't quite believe: What went wrong for the Cardinals, Eagles and Rams?
content: We saw blown leads, bad turnovers, tough calls and one of the weirdest TDs you'll see all season. Let's stack three head-scratching losses from NFL Week 5.

title: 'Beyond repair': Napheesa Collier, Cathy Engelbert and a WNBA teetering on the brink
content: Amid the WNBA Finals, two of the most powerful people in the game are locked in a contentious battle -- for public opinion, power and money.

content: After a disastrous MLB debut, L.A.'s new ninth-inning man has unleashed jaw-dropping stuff in October.

content: Want to know what mask your favorite goalie is wearing this season? We present our goalie mask guide.

content: Many have criticized how the Jaguars are using the rookie two-way threat, but the team has stuck to it's plan.

content: Getting Patrick Mahomes changed the Chiefs' fortunes. But another draft day move helped ensure lasting success.

content: Closing championship windows, new front offices and wild-card teams all highlight Bobby Marks' early NBA trade preview.

content: In Week 6, the Grim Reaper came for Penn State and Texas, but Miami proved itself against Florida State.

content: Does Nico Iamaleava fit into the 2026 class? Could Miami stack first-rounders? We have updates on NFL prospects through CFB Week 6.

title: Singapore shows McLaren's management of title rivals will only get harder
content: Another flash point between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri showed McLaren's ordeal in managing its drivers.

title: After regaining the light heavyweight belt at UFC 320, Alex Pereira should move to heavyweight
content: Now that Pereira is a champ again, the UFC should give the fans the heavyweight blockbuster they want.

content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal tracking Juventus star Yildiz
content: Arsenal remain hopeful of signing Juventus forward Kenan Yildiz in the future. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Nellore-based teacher bags top rank in iGOT Karmayogi national test
content: Challa Chandrasekhar Reddy, mathematics teacher from Chilakalamarri Zilla Parishad High School in Ananthasagaram mandal, scored 5,001 points in a national online test conducted on the digital learning platform

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Ladakh peaceful, says L-G office; LAB calls it illusion, slams 'continuing' arrests
content: Ladakh Chief Secretary Pawan Kotwal had on October 4 said the government stands committed to meet the aspirations of the people of Ladakh and would be keen to start the dialogue process soon

title: NDA pulled Bihar out of 'Jungle Raj'; confident people will again choose development: Amit Shah
content: The Home Minister said Bihar is now witnessing historic changes in every sector, along with poor welfare, infrastructure, health and education

title: Telangana recorded over 4,000 dengue cases between April and August this year: NCVBDC data
content: This national-level update comes amid the Telangana Health Department‚Äôs silence on seasonal disease figures this year

title: 11-month-old baby killed after being run over by car in front of his house
content: The owner of the house, who is also a cab driver, was reversing the vehicle to go to work and allegedly failed to notice the baby playing and ran over him.

title: Karnataka tops the nation in per capita income due to guarantee schemes: Siddaramaiah
content: The Karnataka CM said the guarantee schemes had boosted production, created employment, and, in turn, increased revenue collection.

title: EV prices to match that of petrol vehicles in 4-6 months: Gadkari
content: Mr. Gadkari said India‚Äôs dependence on fossil fuels is both an economic burden, as ‚Çπ22 lakh crore is spent annually on fuel imports, and an environmental hazard, making clean energy adoption crucial

title: Koohoo: A play that runs through railway stations impresses audiences at Heggodu in Shivamogga
content: The play ends with a positive note stating - ‚ÄòThe train to equality and peace is running late, expected to arrive‚Äù

title: NIA chargesheets man for using fake documents to help Lawrence Bishnoi gang members flee country
content: The case relates to a terror conspiracy hatched by Lawrence Bishnoi gang in association with the proscribed BKI terror organisation to spread terrorism in India

title: No one is spared on social media, says Madras High Court judge trolled for condemning Vijay‚Äôs TVK over Karur stampede
content: During the hearing of a civil suit filed by popular chef Madhampatty T. Rangaraj, Justice N. Senthilkumar says: ‚ÄúWhen you gain fame and reach a particular status in society, these things are bound to happen‚Äù

title: CM‚Äôs clean chit to P.P. Divya in Assembly draws criticism
content: KSU vice-president, who filed a complaint against former Kannur district panchayat president P.P. Divya alleging corruption, objects to CM‚Äôs statement in Assembly that the allegations are baseless

title: MUDA case: Enforcement Directorate attaches 34 immovable properties, worth ‚Çπ40.08 crore
content: The ED initiated investigation on the basis of the FIR registered by Lokayukta Police Mysuru in the case of alleged largescale scam in allotment of site by MUDA.

title: Attack on CJI shows how deep hate has seeped in: Congress
content: In a shocking breach of decorum, a 71-year-old lawyer allegedly almost hurled a shoe at CJI Gavai during a court proceeding, but was stopped by the security personnel

title: Karur stampede: A visual timeline
content: This timeline breaks down the sequence of events that unfolded on the day of a stampede that claimed 41 lives so far at Velusamypuram in Karur district of Tamil Nadu during the political rally of actor and Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) president Vijay on September 27, 2025

title: Daily Quiz: Interesting and rare happenings in the life of Mahatma Gandhi¬†
content: As India celebrates the 156th birth anniversary of its Father of the nation, here‚Äôs a quiz on some interesting and rare happenings in the life of Mahatma Gandhi

title: Kerala‚Äôs revenue from lottery may see a dip after GST hike, says Finance Minister K.N. Balagopal
content: The government has made ‚Äúnominal reductions‚Äù in the prize money and agent commission in view of the GST hike on lotteries to 40% from 28%, says K.N. Balagopal

title: Busting fake liquor racket in Annamayya district creates ripples in A.P.
content: The crackdown during the peak of the Dussehra season prompted Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu to review the case and issue directions to officials to ensure strict action against those involved

title: Kisan Mazdoor Morcha demands compensation for flood-hit farmers, holds protest in Punjab
content: The farmer‚Äôs body, Kisan Mazdoor Morcha, protested against government action on stubble burning, and demanded flood relief for farmers in Punjab

title: Kerala Administrative Tribunal flags irregularities in selection process for Principals of arts and science colleges
content: Petitioner contends that selections violate UGC Regulations, 2018, as well as previous orders of KAT. Tribunal hints at judicial intervention, seeks government response

title: Supreme Court seeks responses from Centre, RBI on plea for portal to trace unclaimed financial assets
content: The notice was issued on a petition calling for a centralised system to enable citizens to trace and recover their inactive or unclaimed financial assets

title: Injured makhna takes refuge in Bhavani river along Tamil Nadu-Kerala border
content: Forest Department officials said the elephant was standing in the river for relief from the pain caused by certain injuries. The buoyancy in the water also helps the large mammal to take pressure off the injured limbs

title: Watch: People of Bihar believe Nitish Kumar will do the work again: Upendra Kushwaha
content: Rashtriya Lok Morcha (RLM) president and Rajya Sabha MP Upendra Kushwaha is one of the key partners of the ruling National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in Bihar and a key leader of the¬†Kushwahas, a major OBC community. In an interview to The Hindu ahead of the State‚Äôs Assembly election, Mr. Kushwaha said that Nitish Kumar will continue as Bihar Chief Minister if the NDA is voted to power but refused to speculate on seat-sharing arrangements within the NDA

title: Banks disburse ‚Çπ6,957 crore as loan in Q1 in Alappuzha
content: A total of ‚Çπ4,598 crore was disbursed to the priority sector, ‚Çπ56.03 crore was provided as education loans

title: Jaipur hospital fire: Priyanka Gandhi seeks adequate compensation for victim's families, swift probe
content: The government should provide appropriate compensation to the affected families, conduct a swift investigation into this incident and take strict action so that such an event does not recur, appeals Priyanka Gandhi Vadra

title: Kerala Chief Minister condemns attempted attack on CJI, blames Sangh Parivar‚Äôs politics of hatred
content: The incident serves as a grim reminder of the same extremist mindset that led to the assassination of Mahatma Gandhi, says Pinarayi Vijayan

title: Fresh snowfall in higher reaches of Himachal Pradesh
content: Gondhla and Keylong in Lahaul and Spiti district received 5 cm and 4 cm of snow respectively, officials said

title: CM Himanta launches ‚ÄòShraddhanjali‚Äô scheme to bring back mortal remains of Assamese who die outside the State
content: Chief Minister launches ‚ÄòShraddhanjali‚Äô scheme to bring back mortal remains of deceased from Assam, excluding financially well-off families

title: Pro-Palestine mime restaged at Kerala school fest after controversial halt wins first prize; Yuva Morcha stages protest
content: The performance, presented by six students, was restaged after permission was granted to ensure compliance with the arts festival manual. Earlier, the mime was stopped over allegations of controversial political content

title: Tamil Nadu government announces Deepavali bonus for PSU employees
content: Workers in the C and D categories in profit-making PSUs would get 20% (bonus of 8.33% and 11.67% ex gratia), considering the allocable surplus of the respective PSUs.

title: Nitish inaugurates 3.45-km corridor of Patna Metro hours before Bihar election announcement
content: A section of the Patna Metro was inaugurated by CM Nitish Kumar, with two corridors and 24 stations, a few hours before Bihar election dates announcement

title: Tamil Nadu cybercrime police bust SIM box network
content: Last month, multiple raids were conducted across Tamil Nadu, resulting in the seizure of 14 high-capacity SIM boxes and the arrest of six suspects.¬†

title: Sabarimala gold ‚Äòtheft‚Äô row: Devaswom Minister Vasavan welcomes HC-ordered probe, says incident dates back to 2019
content: Stating that Kerala govt has faith in the HC decision and will fully cooperate with it, Vasavan expresss his conviction that the court-ordered investigation will help uncover the full facts

title: BJP MP Khagen Murmu attacked during relief work in flood-hit north Bengal, party blames Trinamool
content: Malda Uttar legislator Khagen Murmu and BJP MLA Shankar Ghosh, who were visiting the flood and landslide-hit areas for inspection and relief work, were surrounded and attacked by a large group of locals

title: Bengaluru rains: Overnight downpour submerges city roads, disrupts traffic
content: According to data from the GBA, seven trees were uprooted and 25 tree branches snapped due to gusty winds that accompanied the showers.

title: Eli Lilly to invest $1 billion on contract manufacturing; plans oversight facility in Hyderabad
content: Telangana CMO said the State has secured the $1 billion investment, one of the largest pharma investments in recent years

title: Kerala Lok Ayukta issues show-cause notice to Calicut V-C and Registrar
content: The Lok Ayukta is vested with the powers of a civil court while trying a suit under the Code of Civil Procedure, for investigations

title: Traditional houses in Muslim neighborhoods of Udangudi survive against all odds
content: Anyone who visits Udangudi will come across rows of old tiled-roof houses with palm wood trusses on all sixteen streets with Muslim inhabitants, including Periya Theru, Mohideen Puthu Theru, Puthumanai Mela Theru, Puthumanai Vadakku Theru, and Santhaikadai Theru

title: Those opposing Social and Educational Survey don‚Äôt want an equal and egalitarian society: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah
content: The Chief Minister said that the call on extension of survey deadline would be taken on October 7 evening

title: SC refuses to intervene against Telangana govt order enhancing OBC quota to 42% in local bodies
content: The Bench had queried why the petitioner had moved the apex court in the first instance and not moved the High Court

title: Papers hurled at Chief Justice of India-led Bench, fails to break his cool
content: The incident occurred while the Bench was in the process of hearing oral mentionings listed before it

title: Private firm employee from Alappuzha wins ‚Çπ25-crore Thiruvonam bumper in Kerala
content: Sarath S. Nair purchased the winning ticket from the lottery stall of agent Latheesh at Nettoor in Ernakulam

title: Citizens are safe: Maharashtra FDA says no Coldrif syrup supplied in the State
content: The Union Health Ministry has also recommended that cough and cold medications not be prescribed to children under two years of age and has issued guidance to health departments across all states and Union Territories

title: Kerala government tables Malayalam Language Bill in Assembly
content: Law Minister P. Rajeeve says Bill aims to enshrine Malayalam language at the heart of official communications in Kerala

title: Supreme Court decides to examine constitutional validity of Securities Transaction Tax
content: A Bench headed by Justice J.B. Pardiwala issued formal notice to the Union Government, through the Ministry of Finance, on the petition filed by Aseem Juneja

title: Tamil Nadu‚Äôs second mahout village inaugurated at Anamalai Tiger Reserve with solar-powered microgrid
content: According to an official release, the village has been developed at a cost of ‚Çπ5.4 crore and comprises 47 staff quarters for mahouts and elephant caretakers

title: Kerala Assembly: Govt. tables Bill allowing individuals to claim ownership of excess private land in lawful possession identified in digital survey
content: Revenue Minister K. Rajan terms Kerala Excess Land in Private Holding (Regularisation) Bill ‚Äòrevolutionary‚Äô

title: Maharashtra BMC polls: State Election Commission approves ward boundaries
content: The finalised ward structure was published in the Maharashtra Government gazette and uploaded on the BMC's official website on October 6, 2025

title: Kerala HC forms SIT to probe reduced weight of gold-clad plates of Dwarapalaka in Sabarimala
content: SIT to be led by S. Sasidharan, SP of Crime Branch, under the supervision of H. Venkitesh, Additional DGP. Cyber Police too to be part of the team

title: Jharkhand reports record school dropout rate decline in 2024‚Äì25, but activists question data accuracy
content: UDISE+ 2024-25 data shows Jharkhand‚Äôs significant progress in reducing dropout rates, despite challenges in teacher recruitment and infrastructure.

title: Asian push for carbon capture, storage could add 25 billion tonnes of emissions by 2050: report
content: Emissions from many Asian economies, led by India and other developing countries in South and Southeast Asia, show no imminent sign of peaking and rapidly declining, but must quickly reach this tipping point, the report said

title: Sabarimala ‚Äògold theft‚Äô allegations rock Kerala Assembly
content: Protests start as soon as Question Hour began, with Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan demanding Devaswom Minister V.N. Vasavan‚Äôs resignation

title: Bihar Assembly poll dates announcement LIVE: Bihar polls to be held in two phases on November 6 and 11; counting on 14
content: Over 7.4 crore people are eligible to vote in the upcoming Bihar Assembly elections including 14 lakh first-time voters

title: Pakistan Defence Minister Khawaja Asif warns India against any future military conflict
content: Khawaja Asif‚Äôs response came days after Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and Army Chief Gen. Upendra Dwivedi cautioned Pakistan against any misadventure

title: Bomb squad declares threat email to The Hindu‚Äôs Chennai office a hoax
content: The email, sent at 8:45 a.m., was addressed to the Tamil Nadu Director General of Police and The Hindu‚Äôs Readers Editor

title: Dog attacks artiste during street play against stray dog menace in Kerala
content: Mistaking the dog attack for part of the performance, audience initially continued watching until organisers rushed to the theatre activist‚Äôs aid

title: Police book 221 for drinking openly in Guntur district
content: SP Vakul Jindal warned that offenders consuming liquor near schools, colleges, government offices, residential areas, and other sensitive places would face strict legal action

title: Rahul Gandhi condemns Dalit youth lynching in Raebareli: Congress
content: Police in Raebareli arrested five men on October 4 for allegedly lynching Hariom after mistaking him for a drone thief

title: Sonam Wangchuk case: SC asks Centre to consider sharing detention grounds with activist‚Äôs wife, Govt says her plea was to create ‚Äòemotive atmosphere‚Äô
content: Issuing notice to the Centre and the Ladakh administration, the Supreme Court Bench said ‚Äúsomething has been done‚Äù for now, and posted the case for hearing next on October 14

title: Bengal Governor cuts short personal visit to southern states, rushes to landslide-hit Darjeeling
content: The Governor will also submit a report in the evening with specific recommendations to the competent authorities

title: Three militants arrested in Manipur
content: A cadre of the banned Peoples' Liberation Army was arrested from the Keirenphabi Maning Leikai area in the Bishnupur district

title: Waqf board move to earmark land as graveyard hits hurdle in Telangana
content: Minister in-charge of Hyderabad Ponnam Prabhakar had announced to the public on Sunday the earmarking of waqf land for the graveyards, a long-standing demand of locals

title: Prayers and protests in Leh
content: Ladakh‚Äôs Leh town is witnessing a rare post-violence crackdown on activists and youth asking for Statehood and inclusion in the Sixth Schedule. After September 24, when four persons were killed, people‚Äôs voices in the Union Territory are getting more strident around these long-pending demands.¬†The Hindu reports from this strategic region that has international borders with Pakistan and China

title: 2 killed, several injured due to electrocution during idol immersion in Madhya Pradesh‚Äôs Jabalpur
content: The idol, installed for the Navratri festival in Temar Bhita locality under the Gaura Bazar police station area, was being transported for immersion on Sunday night. The truck carrying the idol was fitted with iron poles for decoration

title: Bihar poll dates: Elections to be held in 2 phases on Nov 6 & 11; result on Nov 14
content: The Election Commission of India (ECIannounced the Bihar assembly polls schedule. New guidelines will ensure smoother voting. Polling stations will limit voters. Officials will carry identity cards. Mobile phones can be deposited outside. Webcasting will be complete. EVM ballot papers will feature candidate photos. The election will be a direct contest between NDA and Mahagathbandhan. Political activity will intensify.

title: Bihar polls decoded: Meet the key players ‚Äî What's at stake
content: Bihar's assembly elections, scheduled for November 6 and 11, are poised to be a make-or-break moment for several key political figures. Nitish Kumar faces a legacy-defining test, while Tejashwi Yadav aims for the chief minister's post. Rahul Gandhi's leadership and Congress's revival are on trial.

title: 'Sanatan ka apmaan nahi sahenge': Lawyer tries to hurl shoe towards CJI in SC; how he reacted
content: An advocate hurled a shoe at CJI BR Gavai in protest against his recent "go ask your deity" remark concerning a Lord Vishnu idol's reconstruction plea. Shouting slogans about Sanatan Dharma, the individual was quickly escorted out. CJI Gavai remained unfazed, stating such incidents do not affect him or the court's proceedings.

title: Big news! Rishabh Pant eyes comeback ‚Äì Back in Ranji Trophy
content: Rishabh Pant is nearing a comeback to competitive cricket, with a potential Ranji Trophy return in late October. The BCCI medical team will assess his recovery this week, with clearance possible by October 10. Pant has expressed his desire to play for Delhi, subject to fitness and BCCI approval, aiming for matches from October 25.

title: H-1B visa fee hike: Why global tech startups outside US are ‚Äòhappy‚Äô with new rules
content: New US H-1B visa rules are shifting global tech talent. Companies in the UK and Canada are now attracting skilled engineers. This presents a significant advantage for these international tech hubs. Founders and political leaders recognize this opportunity. Demand for relocation services is surging. This trend is reshaping the landscape for top engineering professionals.

title: Gold prices surge Rs 9,700! Hit fresh high of over Rs 1.3 lakh; what‚Äôs driving rally?
content: Gold rate today: Gold prices in Delhi hit a record high of Rs 1,30,300 per 10 grams on Monday, fueled by global safe-haven demand and a weaker rupee. Silver also saw substantial gains, reaching Rs 1,57,400 per kg. Analysts attribute the surge to investor confidence in bullion amidst economic uncertainties and a strong bullish trend.

title: UP horror: Man molests 14-yr-old girl in Meerut; arrested after video goes viral
content: A 14-year-old girl in Meerut was allegedly molested by Janu alias Jane Alam, who was arrested on Monday. While trying to escape police, he fell into a pit and fractured his arm. The incident, reportedly captured on CCTV, was reported by the girl‚Äôs mother on October 4. A case under BNS and POCSO Sections 7 and 8 has been registered.

title: Controversies galore! How IND-PAK clash turned ugly: Death stare, bug attack & more
content: The India-Pakistan Women's World Cup clash was a high-voltage affair, beginning with captains skipping handshakes and a controversial toss. Play was briefly halted by a swarm of flies, adding to the unusual drama. Pakistan's chase featured a contentious run-out and a heated exchange involving Deepti Sharma. Here's a look at what all transpired in the group stage clash between the two rivals.

title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk says, ‚ÄòI hate QR codes‚Äô
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk recently sparked a lively debate on X by labeling QR codes an "eyesore," particularly disliking their use in restaurant menus. His comments, made in response to a user, highlighted the ongoing divide between those who find QR codes convenient and efficient post-pandemic, and critics who deem them clunky and disruptive to the dining experience.

title: 'Avoid actions that vitiate atmosphere': India tells B'desh; urges timely polls
content: India firmly backs free, fair, and inclusive elections in Bangladesh, urging their earliest possible conduct. Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri stated India will engage with any democratically elected government, emphasizing a pragmatic approach and the need for a conducive environment to strengthen bilateral ties. Global attention is on these upcoming polls.

title: NBA: Ayesha Curry praises husband Stephen's '17-year grind'
content: Ayesha Curry celebrated her husband Stephen Curry's 17th NBA season with an emotional Instagram post after the Golden State Warriors' preseason win. She revealed on a podcast that before meeting Stephen, she never envisioned marriage or motherhood, but their instant connection led her to embrace a life with him and their four children.

title: Arattai launch: Anand Mahindra backs ‚ÄòMade in India‚Äô app; Zoho founder replies
content: Zoho's homegrown messaging app, Arattai, recently gained immense popularity, topping Indian app stores as a "spyware-free, made-in-India" alternative. Industrialist Anand Mahindra publicly endorsed the app, prompting a grateful response from Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu. Despite its rapid rise, Arattai is currently addressing user-reported issues like OTP delays and call glitches.

title: Meet the 2025 Nobel laureates in Physiology: Degrees and labs that shaped their careers
content: Mary E. Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell, and Shimon Sakaguchi received the 2025 Nobel Prize for their discoveries in peripheral immune tolerance. Sakaguchi identified regulatory T cells, while Brunkow and Ramsdell linked FOXP3 gene mutations to T-reg dysfunction, revolutionizing understanding of immune regulation and opening new therapeutic avenues for autoimmune diseases and cancer.

title: 'No kranti‚Äô: CM Sidda loses cool; snaps at minister, scribes
content: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah lost his cool during a media interaction in Koppal, snapping over a misinterpreted question about a separate Lingayat religion, clarifying his non-official stance. He also expressed irritation regarding queries on government guarantees and dismissed "November Kranti," while discussing the ongoing caste census.

title: I knew my stomach pain was cancer, but doctors misdiagnosed: Nafisa Ali
content: Veteran actress Nafisa Ali Sodhi is courageously undergoing chemotherapy for a recurrence of stage 4 peritoneal cancer, after an initial misdiagnosis delayed treatment. She inspires many by openly sharing her journey on Instagram, advocating for a holistic approach to health, including fitness and mental well-being, as she continues her fight with grace.

title: Wayne Gretzky & Janet Jones‚Äô love story: From dance fever to 30 years of marriage
content: Hockey legend Wayne Gretzky and Janet Jones' enduring love story began with a chance meeting in 1981, reigniting at a 1987 Lakers game. Their shared mindset led to a whirlwind romance, a "royal wedding" in 1988, and a family of five children. They prioritized family, making their decades-long marriage a true victory off the ice.

title: Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt questions wellness after Austin health experience
content: Kansas City Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt recently experienced an "eye-opening" holistic wellness assessment at Medici Health, Austin. This comprehensive check-up, spanning heart screenings to vision tests, profoundly highlighted the critical importance of proactive self-care before health issues emerge. Hunt lauded the compassionate team and the Phillips family's vision, advocating for health as a continuous, empowering journey for all.

title: Mark Kastelic charges at Rangers‚Äô 6'9" Matt Rempe, refuses to flinch
content: Bruins' new forward Mark Kastelic charged Rangers' Matt Rempe in their final preseason game after both left the penalty box. This incident followed earlier physical plays and penalties, showcasing Kastelic's gritty character despite a significant size disadvantage. The fight, deemed a draw, highlighted Kastelic's readiness for tough bottom-six roles ahead of the Bruins' October 2025 season opener.

title: Exclusive | ‚ÄòCame for basketball, now stuck in Japan‚Äô: Indian player‚Äôs struggle
content: Indian basketball prodigy Arvinder Singh left Punjab for Japan to play professionally, chasing a dream India‚Äôs inconsistent leagues couldn‚Äôt offer. Living alone, cooking his own meals, and navigating language barriers, he continues to hone his skills, even if it means risking a spot in India‚Äôs World Cup qualifiers. Hope for Indian hoops arrives with the country‚Äôs first professional league in 2026.

title: Nobel Prize: 3 scientists share Medicine award; breakthrough in peripheral immune tolerance
content: Mary E. Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell, and Shimon Sakaguchi have been awarded the 2025 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for their discoveries concerning peripheral immune tolerance. Their work identified regulatory T cells, crucial for regulating the immune system and preventing autoimmune diseases. This groundbreaking research reshaped immunology, opening new avenues for treating autoimmune conditions and advancing cancer therapies.

title: IND vs AUS: AB de Villiers hails Abhishek Sharma; drops bold prediction
content: Cricket legend AB de Villiers predicts Indian opener Abhishek Sharma will excel in the upcoming Australia T20I series. Following his stellar Asia Cup performance, where he amassed 314 runs with a 200 strike rate, de Villiers believes the bouncy Australian pitches suit Sharma's aggressive style.

title: Kerala‚Äôs Right to Disconnect Bill: Switch off after work; career shield against burnout
content: Kerala plans a Right to Disconnect Bill for 2025. This bill protects private sector employees from after-hours work demands. Research suggests effective implementation needs clear rules and company policies. It also requires manager training and grievance committees. This initiative aims to improve employee well-being and productivity. The bill seeks to balance work and personal life.

title: Bronny James gets sweet birthday note from girlfriend Parker Whitfield
content: Bronny James celebrated his 21st birthday. His girlfriend Parker Whitfield shared a birthday wish. Bronny also thanked her on social media. This occurred after Bronny faced criticism for his recent basketball game performance. He scored 8.3 percent from the field. Bronny expressed satisfaction with his shots. His family and coach supported him.

title: Explosive outburst! Pak batter reprimanded after bat-smashing rant against India
content: Pakistan batter Sidra Amin received an ICC reprimand and a demerit point for breaching the Code of Conduct during the Women's World Cup match against India. Amin, who scored 81, hit her bat on the pitch after dismissal, violating Article 2.2 concerning abuse of cricket equipment. She accepted the charges, avoiding a formal hearing.

title: Bengal: BJP MP attacked while visiting flood-affected area; party blames TMC
content: BJP MP Khagen Murmu sustained serious head injuries after being attacked by locals with stones while visiting flood-affected areas in North Bengal. The incident occurred as he was overseeing relief operations, prompting the BJP to condemn the ruling TMC for targeting leaders engaged in humanitarian work amidst severe flooding and landslides.

title: Bad Bunny‚Äôs shift from LGBTQ+ ally to 2026 Super Bowl headliner
content: Bad Bunny's selection as Super Bowl 2026 headliner sparked immediate backlash on social media, with critics questioning his style and sexuality. Despite identifying as heterosexual, the artist faces accusations of "queerbaiting" for his gender-fluid expression. He dedicates this historic performance to his culture, actively fighting misogyny and homophobia, a crucial aspect often overlooked by U.S. audiences.

title: No impact of Trump pressure? Russia remains India‚Äôs main crude oil supplier; most economical option
content: India's crude oil imports from Russia slightly decreased in September but still comprised over one-third of its total acquisitions, with Russia remaining the top supplier. Despite US pressure, Russian barrels are crucial for Indian refiners due to their economic viability and embedded supply chains, ensuring their core position in India's import mix.

title: Nobel Medicine Prize: How three scientists found the body's peacekeepers
content: Your immune system is your body‚Äôs army. It fights off viruses, bacteria, and infections every day. Its elite soldiers are called T cells. Some T cells attack invaders directly, while others coordinate the fight like generals. But sometimes, the army makes a terrible mistake ‚Äî it attacks its own country.

title: The sex scandal threatening ICC chief prosecutor Karim Khan's legacy
content: Khan, who issued unprecedented arrest warrants against Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Defence Minister Yoav Gallant for war crimes in Gaza, is facing serious allegations of sexual misconduct made by a former aide. The timing of the allegations ‚Äî surfacing soon after the Israeli warrants ‚Äî has fuelled claims of political sabotage and divided international opinion over whether justice or geopolitics is on trial.

title: Riyadh Season 2025 kick-off: Opening parade, celebrity lineup, & top attractions
content: Riyadh Season 2025 officially kicks off on Friday, October 10, with a spectacular grand parade and six immersive entertainment zones. Featuring global stars, major sporting events like Six Kings Slam, and music festivals, the season promises diverse cultural experiences and thrilling adventures. Tickets start at SAR 25, offering fun for all ages.

title: Terror tag defied: Bishnoi gang carried out shootings at several locations in Canada; videos surface
content: The Lawrence Bishnoi gang, via Fateh Portugal, claimed responsibility for multiple shootings across Canada, targeting locations linked to Navi Tesi. They accused Tesi of extorting 5 million from singers in the gang's name. The group issued warnings against false accusations and spreading misinformation, emphasizing respect for honest individuals.

title: Taylor Swift‚Äôs ‚ÄòFate of Ophelia‚Äô video hides emotional tributes to Travis Kelce
content: Taylor Swift's new music video for ‚ÄúThe Fate of Ophelia,‚Äù released on Travis Kelce‚Äôs birthday, serves as a heartfelt love letter to the NFL star. It features symbolic nods like Swift catching a football and entering room #87, alongside a hidden photo of Kelce. This visual tribute, part of her new album era, celebrates their relationship's journey.

title: Watch: Rowdy celebrates birthday inside Bengaluru prison; video goes viral
content: A viral video shows undertrial prisoner Gubbachhi Seena celebrating his birthday with cake and a large knife inside Bengaluru's Central Prison, prompting an ADGP inquiry. The celebration, recorded on a mobile phone, occurred months ago. Seena, accused of murder, had his rival's wife expose the clip. Police are now investigating mobile phone entry and facilitation of the event.

title: IND vs PAK: Deepti hits Pakistan batter with throw, gives death stares ‚Äì Watch
content: India maintained their perfect Women's World Cup record, defeating Pakistan by 88 runs to extend their dominance to 12-0. The intense rivalry spilled onto the field with skipped handshakes, heated exchanges, and a controversial run-out. Deepti Sharma, involved in a clash with Sidra Amin, was ironically named best fielder. India now faces South Africa and Australia next.

title: Gold prices hit record highs: US shutdown, Fed rate cut bets boost demand
content: Gold prices surged to unprecedented levels globally and domestically, driven by safe-haven demand amidst the US government shutdown and anticipated Federal Reserve rate cuts. MCX gold futures hit new records, with the February 2026 contract reaching Rs 1,20,845 per 10 grams. Silver also rallied significantly as investors sought safety, despite mixed physical demand.

title: Jail escape bid foiled: Ghaziabad cops use fake order to free 2 prisoners; arrested
content: Two police constables tried to facilitate the release of two inmates from Dasna Jail. They presented documents they claimed were court orders. Jail officials noted discrepancies in the papers. A verification call confirmed no court productions were scheduled. The constables then fled the scene. They were later suspended and arrested. An investigation into their motives and connections is now underway.

title: France‚Äôs new PM resigns hours after cabinet unveiled; Macron accepts resignation
content: France's newly appointed Prime Minister S√©bastien Lecornu resigned just hours after unveiling his cabinet, highlighting growing political instability. This marks a significant challenge for President Emmanuel Macron, who faces immense pressure to secure broad support and demonstrate a clear break from previous policies amidst a divided parliament.

title: Wangchuk case: SC issues notice to Centre; refuses to pass order on providing detention grounds
content: The Supreme Court issued notice to the central government and Ladakh UT. This action addresses Sonam Wangchuk's detention after violent protests in Ladakh. His wife challenged his arrest under the National Security Act. Wangchuk advocated for Ladakh's statehood and 6th Schedule inclusion. Authorities alleged he incited violence. His wife sought presidential intervention for his release.

title: Mid-air scare: Pilots' body writes to DGCA after RAT deployed on Air India flight
content: The DGCA is investigating an uncommanded Ram Air Turbine (RAT) deployment on an Air India flight (AI-117) at 400ft before landing in Birmingham on October 4, 2025. Despite Boeing's recommended maintenance finding no discrepancies, the regulator deemed a detailed probe necessary, especially given a recent fatal Air India 787 crash.

title: Harjit or Sarabjit? US-deported grandma fights name muddle; explains dual names
content: Deported from the US after three decades, Harjit Kaur clarified her identity to TOI amidst name confusion. Official records confirm her birth name as Sarabjit, though some family use Harjit. While a 1992 marriage certificate lists her as Harjit, she maintains all her documents are Sarabjit. She also refuted social media allegations of impersonation, asserting her true identity.

title: Jaipur hospital fire: Witnesses recall horror; relatives of patients claim staff fled as smoke spread
content: A devastating fire, caused by a short circuit, erupted in the Trauma ICU of SMS Hospital in Jaipur, leading to chaos and multiple casualties. Hospital staff reportedly fled, leaving panicked relatives to rescue trapped patients amidst thick smoke. The incident tragically resulted in patient deaths and exposed critical safety lapses within the facility.

title: Gold price prediction: What's the rate outlook for Oct 6 - Check key details
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are expected to maintain their bullish rally, driven by robust safe-haven demand amid intensifying geopolitical and economic uncertainty, including the US government shutdown and rising Fed rate cut expectations.

title: The 7 X Factors In Bihar Assembly Election 2025
content: Bihar faces a unique assembly election again. It is the first election to be held in the state after the Election Commission (EC) carried out the special intensive revision (SIR) exercise.

title: Navi Mumbai International Airport At A Glance: Capacity, Terminals, Amenities
content: The Navi Mumbai International Airport (NMIA) will be inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on October 8.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Straight Talk: Just How Big Is The Effect Of Trump Tariffs On India?
content: Despite headline growth figures signalling resilience, India's informal sector, which employs hundreds of millions, remains exposed to external shocks and structural weaknesses.

title: Rescue Ops On As Several Missing In Bengal Floods, Death Count Rises To 28
content: The death count in the devastating landslides and floods in northern West Bengal rose to 28, as disaster management personnel continued the rescue operation with several people still missing and thousands of tourists stranded in cut-off hill pockets

title: Drunk Man Loses Phone, Lies It Was Robbed To Escape Wife's Anger
content: A man who complained about his mobile phone being snatched in Outer Delhi's Nangloi area was found to have cooked up the story to escape his wife's anger after losing it in a drunken state, police said on Monday.

title: Amid Cough Syrup Deaths, Kerala Bans All Medicines For Children Under 12 Without Prescription
content: The Kerala Health Department on Monday ordered that no medicines should be given to children under 12 without a doctor's prescription, a move taken in the wake of concerns over certain cough syrups.

title: "Time To Apologise, Accept Mistake": Kamal Haasan Visits Karur Stampede Site
content: It is "time to apologise, time to accept mistake", underlined Makkal Needhi Maiam chief Kamal Haasan on Monday as he visited the site of stampede at a TVK rally, fronted by Vijay, in Karur to meet the families of the victims.

title: 17 New Reforms In Bihar Polls That Will Be Implemented Across India
content: The Bihar polls for 243 assembly seats will be held in two phases: November 6 and 11. The votes will be counted on November 14.

title: FAQs: Bihar Assembly Election 2025
content: The people of Bihar will vote in two phases in their first assembly election after the Election Commission (EC) carried out the special intensive revision (SIR) exercise.

title: 'Stalker' Twice Came Close To Prince Harry On Recent UK Trip: Report
content: A woman, who is a known stalker of Prince Harry, came close to the son of King Charles on two occasions during his recent visit to Britain, a security source for the prince said.

title: The Gaza Twins Whose Whole Lives Have Been War
content: Palestinian twins Uday and Hamza Abu Odah have known nothing but war since they were born in Gaza, less than a month after the conflict began on October 7, 2023.

title: Mobile Phones At Bihar Polling Booths? What Election Commission Said
content: Mobiles, which increasingly appear as an extension of a person, have often been a problem at polling stations. Not anymore, says the Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar, who found a way to accommodate it as he announced a set of new initiatives.

title: 8 Arrested Amid Curfew, Internet Ban After Clashes In Odisha's Cuttack
content: Eight people were arrested on Monday in connection with the violence in Odisha's Cuttack, where a 12-hour bandh was underway amid heavy security deployment with prohibitory orders in place, officials said.

title: Indian Navy Commissions Anti-Submarine Warfare Vessel In Visakhapatnam
content: The Indian Navy on Monday commissioned 'Androth', the second Anti-Submarine Warfare Shallow Water Craft, during a ceremonial event at the Naval Dockyard here.

title: Defender, Challenger, Disruptor: Bihar Poll Dates Out, Focus On 3 Leaders
content: As the political battleground of Bihar prepares for the upcoming Assembly polls, the spotlight is on three figures who face the acid test in this election

title: "Not Kidnapping But Organised Crime": Cops To Court On Puja Khedkar's Family
content: In a courtroom in Navi Mumbai this week, police presented a series of allegations that cast the now-infamous "truck cleaner kidnapping case" not as a simple road rage incident, but as organised crime.

title: Battleground Bihar: Election Dates To Be Announced Shortly
content: The Election Commission is set to announce the schedule for the high-stakes Bihar Assembly elections shortly.

title: Video Of African King's Arrival In UAE With 15 Wives, 100 Aides Resurfaces
content: In the footage, the king is seen stepping off a private jet dressed in traditional attire. A group of elegantly dressed women follow him.

title: Dog Joins Cast Midway, Bites Actor In Kerala Street Play On Strays
content: A street play meant to raise awareness against the stray dog menace in Kerala's Kannur took an ironic turn when a dog bit the artist in the middle of the performance.

title: Nobel In Medicine Awarded For "Discoveries On Peripheral Immune Tolerance"
content: Mary E Brunkow and Fred Ramsdell of the United States and Japan's Shimon Sakaguchi won the Nobel Prize in Medicine on Monday for research into how the immune system is kept in check, the Nobel jury said.

title: Power Rankings: Penn State drops out of Top 25 as three new teams join the list
content: Memphis' Cortez Braham Jr. hauls in a one-handed touchdown grab to increase the Tigers' lead against Tulsa . the Buckeyes offense has been more potent as of late, but there are areas to improve, just like there are with many units . a new group of standout quarterbacks has emerged, including Oregon 's Dante Moore and Ole Miss' Trinidad Chambliss .

title: WWE Crown Jewel: Key stats and info to know before Saturday's premium live event
content: the premium live event (PLE) will be headlined by a pair of matches for the men's and women's crown jewel championships . undisputed WWE champion Cody Rhodes will challenge world heavyweight champion seth Rollins in one match .

title: Week 5 overreactions: Patriots to playoffs? A.J. Brown gone by trade deadline?
content: this is Week 5 and the outlines of the overreactions are starting to get a little bit clearer . we have enough evidence that we can talk with some confidence about what these teams are and what they aren't . it's safe to believe the Colts are good, the Lions are still a top contender .

title: Sorting out the bowl picture after another weekend of surprises
content: two preseason college football playoff contenders lost to opponents who had disappointed . last season's inaugural 12-team CFP, the five highest-ranked conference champions will make the field . the other eight teams will meet in first-round games at the campus sites of seeds Nos. 5 through 8 .

title: Your guide to the Aces going up 2-0 against the Mercury in the 2025 WNBA Finals
content: the no. 2 Las Vegas Aces beat the Phoenix Mercury 91-78 in Game 2 of the 2025 WNBA Finals . Jackie Young had 32 points while four-time MVP A'ja Wilson had 28 points and 14 rebounds . despite a quiet scoring performance, Alyssa Thomas passed Courtney Vandersloot to become the all-time leader in postseason assists .

title: NHL season preview: Strengths, weaknesses, X factors for all 32 teams
content: the opening night of the 2025-26 NHL season is Tuesday . this preview will serve you all the key intel you need on all 32 teams, including strengths, weaknesses, X factors, most likely award winners, fantasy tips and a bold prediction . the weekly rankings are formulated through votes from ESPN hockey broadcasters, analysts and reporters.
